entry.content:

å‚è€ƒé“¾æ¥ï¼š

  • https://patchstack.com/database/wordpress/plugin/aibuddy-openai-chatgpt/vulnerability/wordpress-aibud-wp-plugin-1-8-5-arbitrary-file-upload-vulnerability?_s_id=cve

Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type vulnerability in WPCenter AiBud WP allows Upload a Web Shell to a Web Server.This issue affects AiBud WP: from n/a through 1.8.5.

entry.title: NextJS vulnerability can lead to DoS via cache poisoning
entry.content:
é“¾æ¥ï¼š https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-67rr-84xm-4c7r

ä»“åº“ Starï¼š 132887

CVSS è¯„åˆ†ï¼š 7.5

å‚è€ƒé“¾æ¥ï¼š

  • https://github.com/vercel/next.js/security/advisories/GHSA-67rr-84xm-4c7r

  • https://github.com/vercel/next.js/commit/16bfce64ef2157f2c1dfedcfdb7771bc63103fd2

  • https://github.com/vercel/next.js/commit/a15b974ed707d63ad4da5b74c1441f5b7b120e93

  • https://vercel.com/changelog/cve-2025-49826

  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-67rr-84xm-4c7r

æè¿°ï¼š

Summary

A vulnerability affecting Next.js has been addressed. It impacted versions 15.0.4 through 15.1.8 and involved a cache poisoning bug leading to a Denial of Service (DoS) condition.

Under certain conditions, this issue may allow a HTTP 204 response to be cached for static pages, leading to the 204 response being served to all users attempting to access the page

More details: CVE-2025-49826

Credits

  • Allam Rachid zhero;
  • Allam Yasser (inzo)

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š å—å½±å“çš„äº§å“æ˜¯Sudoï¼Œä¸€ä¸ªåœ¨Unixå’Œç±»Unixæ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿä¸­å¹¿æ³›ä½¿ç”¨çš„ç¨‹åºï¼Œå…è®¸ç”¨æˆ·ä»¥å…¶ä»–ç”¨æˆ·çš„å®‰å…¨æƒé™è¿è¡Œç¨‹åºï¼Œé€šå¸¸æ˜¯è¶…çº§ç”¨æˆ·ã€‚Sudoæ˜¯ç³»ç»Ÿç®¡ç†å‘˜å’Œé«˜çº§ç”¨æˆ·çš„å¸¸ç”¨å·¥å…·ï¼Œç”¨äºå§”æ´¾æƒé™å’Œæ‰§è¡Œéœ€è¦æ›´é«˜æƒé™çš„ä»»åŠ¡ã€‚è¯¥æ¼æ´æ¶‰åŠSudoçš„chrootåŠŸèƒ½ï¼Œè¯¥åŠŸèƒ½å…è®¸ç”¨æˆ·åœ¨æ›´æ”¹æ ¹ç›®å½•çš„ç¯å¢ƒä¸­è¿è¡Œå‘½ä»¤ï¼Œè¿™åœ¨å¤šç”¨æˆ·ç¯å¢ƒå’Œç³»ç»Ÿç®¡ç†ä¸­æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªé‡è¦çš„å®‰å…¨ç‰¹æ€§ã€‚æ¼æ´çš„æŠ€æœ¯æ ¹æºåœ¨äºSudoåœ¨å¤„ç†chrootå‘½ä»¤æ—¶çš„æƒé™æå‡æœºåˆ¶å­˜åœ¨ç¼ºé™·ï¼Œæ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥åˆ©ç”¨è¿™ä¸€ç¼ºé™·åœ¨ç‰¹å®šæ¡ä»¶ä¸‹ç»•è¿‡é¢„æœŸçš„æƒé™é™åˆ¶ï¼Œä»è€Œè·å¾—æœªæˆæƒçš„rootæƒé™ã€‚è¿™ç§æ¼æ´çš„å½±å“éå¸¸ä¸¥é‡ï¼Œå› ä¸ºå®ƒå…è®¸æ”»å‡»è€…åœ¨ä¸éœ€è¦ä»»ä½•è®¤è¯çš„æƒ…å†µä¸‹ï¼Œç›´æ¥æå‡åˆ°æœ€é«˜æƒé™ï¼Œæ‰§è¡Œä»»æ„å‘½ä»¤ï¼Œå®Œå…¨æ§åˆ¶ç³»ç»Ÿã€‚ç”±äºSudoçš„å¹¿æ³›ä½¿ç”¨ï¼Œè¿™ä¸€æ¼æ´å¯¹è®¸å¤šç³»ç»Ÿæ„æˆäº†é‡å¤§å¨èƒï¼Œå°¤å…¶æ˜¯é‚£äº›ä¾èµ–äºSudoè¿›è¡Œæƒé™ç®¡ç†çš„æœåŠ¡å™¨å’Œå·¥ä½œç«™ã€‚æ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥åˆ©ç”¨æ­¤æ¼æ´è¿›è¡Œè¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œã€æ•°æ®æ³„éœ²å’ŒæœåŠ¡ä¸­æ–­ç­‰æ¶æ„æ´»åŠ¨ï¼Œä¸”æ”»å‡»è¿‡ç¨‹å¯ä»¥è‡ªåŠ¨åŒ–æ‰§è¡Œï¼Œå¢åŠ äº†æ¼æ´çš„å±é™©æ€§ã€‚

entry.title: Nextjs has a Cache poisoning vulnerability due to omission of the Vary header
entry.content:
é“¾æ¥ï¼š https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r2fc-ccr8-96c4

ä»“åº“ Starï¼š 132887

CVSS è¯„åˆ†ï¼š 3.7

å‚è€ƒé“¾æ¥ï¼š

  • https://github.com/vercel/next.js/security/advisories/GHSA-r2fc-ccr8-96c4

  • https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/79939

  • https://github.com/vercel/next.js/releases/tag/v15.3.3

  • https://vercel.com/changelog/cve-2025-49005

  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r2fc-ccr8-96c4

æè¿°ï¼š

Summary

A cache poisoning issue in Next.js App Router >=15.3.0 and < 15.3.3 may have allowed RSC payloads to be cached and served in place of HTML, under specific conditions involving middleware and redirects. This issue has been fixed in Next.js 15.3.3.

Users on affected versions should upgrade immediately and redeploy to ensure proper caching behavior.

More details: CVE-2025-49005

Multi-host, multi-port scanner and auditor for CVE-2025-6543-affected NetScaler devices. Supports SNMP and SSH enumeration with optional CSV reporting and exploit stubs.

ğŸ” GitHub Repository Description

CVE-2025-6543 Enhanced Checker
Multi-host, multi-port scanner and auditor for CVE-2025-6543-affected NetScaler devices. Supports SNMP and SSH enumeration with optional CSV reporting and exploit stubs.

ğŸ“„ README.md

ğŸš€ Usage

ğŸ”¹ Input Options

Required: either provide a host list or a file:

  • -H HOST [HOST ...] â€“ Space-separated list of IPs/FQDNs
  • -f FILE â€“ File with one host per line

Required: either provide a port or a file:

  • -p PORT â€“ Single TCP port
  • -P FILE â€“ File with one port per line

ğŸ”¹ Connection Options

  • --no-snmp â€“ Disable SNMP scanning
  • -c STRING â€“ SNMP community string (default: public)
  • --ssh-user USER â€“ SSH username
  • --ssh-pass PASS â€“ SSH password

ğŸ”¹ Output & Exploitation

  • -o FILE â€“ Save results to CSV
  • -x â€“ Run exploit probe (currently stubbed)

ğŸ”¹ Debugging

  • -v â€“ Verbose output for debugging and banner grabs

ğŸ“˜ Example Usages

Scan multiple hosts on one port:

ğŸ“ Output Format (CSV)

If -o is used, the output file will include:

ğŸ”’ About CVE-2025-6543

This vulnerability affects certain builds of Citrix NetScaler ADC/VPX appliances. The tool checks for known patched versions and flags devices that are potentially vulnerable based on build signatures. The included banner parsing logic supports various formats and tags (e.g., FIPS, NDCPP).

âš ï¸ Disclaimer

This tool is for educational and authorized security testing only. Unauthorized use against systems you do not own or have explicit permission to test is illegal and unethical.
